instruction: Fill a large pot with enough water to comfortably cover the macaroni. Add a generous pinch of salt (or 1 tablespoon) and bring the water to a rolling boil over high heat.
Add the macaroni to the boiling water and cook according to the package instructions, typically for 8-12 minutes, or until al dente (slightly firm to the bite).
While the macaroni cooks, melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Once melted, whisk in the milk and bring to a simmer. Do not let it boil.
Reduce heat to low and gradually whisk in the shredded cheddar cheese until melted and smooth. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper to taste (optional).
Drain the cooked macaroni and return it to the pot.
Pour the cheese sauce over the macaroni and toss to coat evenly.
